 PREV PACKAGE   NEXT PACKAGE FRAMES    NO FRAMES    

Package de.unisiegen.tpml.core.expressions

Interface Summary
PrettyPrintPriorities This interface includes the pretty print priorities, according to the priority grammar, for the various expressions.
 

Class Summary
And Instances of this class represent and expressions, printed as e1 && e2.
Application Represents the (APP) expression in the expression hierarchy.
ArithmeticOperator Instances of this class represent arithmetic operators in the expression hierarchy.
Assign The Assign.ASSIGN constant in this class represents the := operator in the expression hierarchy.
BinaryCons The binary version of the cons operator, written as :: (two colons), which is syntactic sugar for the unary cons operator.
BinaryOperator Abstract base class for binary operators.
BooleanConstant The BooleanConstant.FALSE and BooleanConstant.TRUE instances of the BooleanConstant class are used to represent the logic false and true values in the expression hierarchy.
Condition Represents the conditional evaluation in the expression hierarchy.
Condition1 Instances of this class represent conditions without an else block in the expression hierarchy.
Constant Abstract class to represent a constant expression (only values can be constants).
CurriedLet Instances of this class represents curried let expressions, which are syntactic sugar for Let and Lambda.
CurriedLetRec Instances of this class represent curried let rec expressions in the expression hierarchy.
Deref The Deref.DEREF constant in this class represents the !
EmptyList The constant for the empty list, represented as [], which must be handled differently from the List expressions, which are syntactic sugar.
Exn Instances of this class represent exceptions in the expression hierarchy.
Expression Base class for all classes in the expression hierarchy.
Fst Instances of this class represent the fst operator in the expression hierarchy, which is syntactic sugar for #2_1.
Hd The hd operator, which, when applied to a list, returns the first item of the list, or raises an empty_list exception if the list is empty.
Identifier Represents an identifier in the expression hierarchy.
InfixOperation Instances of this class are used to represent infix operations, which act as syntactic sugar for applications.
IntegerConstant Instances of this class are used to represent integer constants in the expression hierarchy.
IsEmpty The is_empty operator, which, when applied to a list, returns true if the list is empty, or false if the list contains atleast one item.
Lambda Represents the (ABSTR) expression in the expression hierarchy, which is used for lambda abstractions.
Let Represents the simple binding mechanism let.
LetRec Represents the let rec expression, which is syntactic sugar for (LET) and (REC).
List Syntactic sugar for lists.
Location Instances of this class are used to represent memory locations as returned by the ref operator and used by the := (Assign) and !
MultiLambda Represents a multi lambda abstract, which takes a single tuple argument as parameter and splits the tuple items to various identifiers.
MultiLet Instances of this class represent multi let expressions in the expression hierarchy, which assign identifiers values from tuple items.
Not The Not.NOT instance of this class represents the not operator in the expression hierarchy.
Or Instances of this class represent or expressions, printed as e1 || e2.
Projection Instances of this class represent projections in the expression hierarchy.
Recursion Instances of this class are used to represent recursive expressions in the expression hierarchy.
Ref The Ref.REF constant in this class represents the ref operator in the expression hierarchy.
RelationalOperator Instances of this class represent relational operators in the expression hierarchy.
Sequence Instances of this class represent statements for sequential execution of commands in the expression hierarchy.
Snd Instances of this class represent the snd operator in the expression hierarchy, which is syntactic sugar for #2_2.
Tl The tl operator, which, when applied to a list, returns the list without the first item, or when applied to an empty list, raises the empty_list exception.
Tuple Instances of this class represent tuples in the expression hierarchy.
UnaryCons The cons operator, which takes a pair, with an element and a list, and constructs a new list.
UnaryListOperator Abstract base class for the various list operators, that have to be handled by the interpreters and the type checker.
UnaryOperator Abstract base class for unary operators in the expression hierarchy.
UnitConstant The single UnitConstant.UNIT instance of this class represents the constant unit value in the expression hierarchy.
Value Abstract base class for expression classes, whose instances are always values, for example Lambda expressions.
While Instances of this class represent while expressions in the expression hierarchy that serve as syntactic sugar introduce with the imperative concepts.
 

Exception Summary
BinaryOperatorException This exception is thrown whenever a expressions.BinaryOperator is being applied to invalid operands during the evaluation.
UnaryOperatorException This exception is thrown whenever an expressions.UnaryOperator is being applied to an invalid operand during evaluation.
